newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy DPEF plan to cabinet Thurs or Friday-Micheli.
newsitem.headline: Italy DPEF plan to cabinet Thurs or Friday-Micheli.

text.p: The Italian government's three-year document of rolling economic targets (DPEF) will probably be approved by the cabinet next Thursday or Friday, cabinet secretary Enrico Micheli said.
"It will probably be next Thursday or Friday," he told reporters when asked when the cabinet would meet to approve the document which should also contain 1998 budget details.

Asked if the 1989 budget package would total 25 trillion lire as Foreign Trade Minister Augusto Fantozzi had earlier today mentioned, Micheli said "the figure is more or less what you have already heard."
As to the breakdown of spending cuts and increased revenue, he would only say, "you must wait for the document."
